question: During a recent plane journey, you sat next to a businessman who owns a chain of restaurants. You talked to him and he suggested that you should contact him about a possible job in one of his restaurants.* remind him when and where you met* tell him what kind of job you are interested in* say why you think you would be suitable for the job
text: I am Manpreet Kaur, and I am lucky enough to introduce myself to you a few days ago when we both were flying from Mohali to Bengaluru. We discussed  various things including  your restaurant business "The Taj".

It was very kind of you to advise me to think big of my career. And, you asked me to contact you if I need any job opportunities. I think you might have a suitable place for me. So, here I am sir, I would love to join your business if you have the position of  head chef in your restaurant.

For your kind consideration, I would like to explain that I have been working as a head chef in "Sagar Ratna". I was a fresher when I joined the job over there. Now, after acquiring five years of experience, I have learnt a variety of dishes. I am passionate about my work and your restaurant would be a perfect platform for my career growth. Furthermore, you would get  young talent and it would be a win-win situation.
I would very much like to work in your restaurant. I hope you would give me an opportunity to prove my worth.
